algorithm_technique: Construct the string greedily by assigning characters. Use the LCP matrix to infer relationships and validate the construction. Check for inconsistencies.
problem_summary_simple: Reconstruct the lexicographically smallest string given its LCP matrix, ensuring consistency with LCP values.
problem_summary_technical: Greedily assigns characters to positions based on LCP values, then validates the constructed string against the LCP matrix properties.
key_insights: The LCP matrix provides constraints on the relationships between suffixes.
The problem can be solved by assigning characters greedily and then verifying.
The condition `lcp[i][j] = lcp[i+1][j+1] + 1` if `word[i] == word[j]` is crucial for validation.
